stance_1: Conflicting messages about meat cause confusion
stance_2: I was raised to believe eating meat is important
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that current conflicting messages about meat are confusing given their upbringing that taught meat is important.

stance_2: I was raised to believe eating meat is important
justification: The interviewee links eating meat daily to being raised to believe it is important, indicating upbringing supports current behavior.
The interviewee explicitly says they try to eat meat daily because it makes them feel full.

stance_2: Meat is important to every meal
justification: The interviewee directly connects eating meat every day to believing meat is important in every meal.
The prevalence of meat-eating among social contacts plausibly supports the interviewee's daily meat consumption.

stance_2: Meat is important to every meal
justification: The feeling that only meals with meat are satisfying reinforces the belief that meat is important to every meal.

stance_2: I was raised to believe eating meat is important
justification: Social environment and upbringing both reinforce the norm of eating meat.

stance_2: Social contacts are concerned about animal welfare
justification: The interviewee notes that while most social contacts eat meat, only some are concerned about animal welfare and avoid meat.
